In the year<S>8141</S> that Tartan<S>8661</S> came<S>935</S> unto Ashdod<S>795</S>, (when Sargon<S>5623</S> the king<S>4428</S> of Assyria<S>804</S> sent<S>7971</S> him,) and fought<S>3898</S> against Ashdod<S>795</S>, and took<S>3920</S> it;
At the same time<S>6256</S> spake<S>1696</S> the LORD<S>3068</S> by<S>3027</S> Isaiah<S>3470</S> the son<S>1121</S> of Amoz<S>531</S>, saying<S>559</S>, Go<S>3212</S> and loose<S>6605</S> the sackcloth<S>8242</S> from off thy loins<S>4975</S>, and put off<S>2502</S> thy shoe<S>5275</S> from thy foot<S>7272</S>. And he did so<S>6213</S>, walking<S>1980</S> naked<S>6174</S> and barefoot<S>3182</S>. <sup>by: Heb. by the hand of</sup>
And the LORD<S>3068</S> said<S>559</S>, Like as my servant<S>5650</S> Isaiah<S>3470</S> hath walked<S>1980</S> naked<S>6174</S> and barefoot<S>3182</S> three<S>7969</S> years<S>8141</S> for a sign<S>226</S> and wonder<S>4159</S> upon Egypt<S>4714</S> and upon Ethiopia<S>3568</S>;
So shall the king<S>4428</S> of Assyria<S>804</S> lead away<S>5090</S> the Egyptians<S>4714</S> prisoners<S>7628</S>, and the Ethiopians<S>3568</S> captives<S>1546</S>, young<S>5288</S> and old<S>2205</S>, naked<S>6174</S> and barefoot<S>3182</S>, even with their buttocks<S>8357</S> uncovered<S>2834</S>, to the shame<S>6172</S> of Egypt<S>4714</S>. <sup>the Egyptians: Heb. the captivity of Egypt</sup> <sup>shame: Heb. nakedness</sup>
And they shall be afraid<S>2865</S> and ashamed<S>954</S> of Ethiopia<S>3568</S> their expectation<S>4007</S>, and of Egypt<S>4714</S> their glory<S>8597</S>.
And the inhabitant<S>3427</S> of this isle<S>339</S> shall say<S>559</S> in that day<S>3117</S>, Behold, such<S>3541</S> is our expectation<S>4007</S>, whither we flee<S>5127</S> for help<S>5833</S> to be delivered<S>5337</S> from<S>6440</S> the king<S>4428</S> of Assyria<S>804</S>: and how shall we escape<S>4422</S>? <sup>isle: or, country</sup>
